body_html: @F3PiX Oh. In that case it would be good to get the feed pass validation first 😉 I recommend using the W3C validator, though; it allows uploading of text as opposed to referencing a website. It makes development much easier (since your localhost cannot be reached by the W3C validator machine).
body_text: @F3PiX Oh. In that case it would be good to get the feed pass validation first 😉 I recommend using the W3C validator, though; it allows uploading of text as opposed to referencing a website. It makes development much easier (since your localhost cannot be reached by the W3C validator machine).
body: @F3PiX Oh. In that case it would be good to get the feed pass validation first :wink: I recommend using [the W3C validator](http://validator.w3.org/feed/), though; it allows uploading of text as opposed to referencing a website. It makes development much easier (since your localhost cannot be reached by the W3C validator machine).
